title: Errors of the Indonesian sentence structures and orthographic convention in the theses of marketing mangement students of Petra Christian University
abstract: This research is about the sentence structures and orthographic convention that occured in the twenty theses made by students of marketing management, Faculty of Economic, Petra Christian University batch 2008-2009. The writer categorized the errors that the students made based on the errors which are caused by ambiguity errors, sentence errors by diction errors (Sugono’s book), errors in the writing element absorption, incorrect lower-case letter (by Pusat Bahasa’s book), errors in differentiating di as a preposition and di- as a prefix (by Badudu’s book). The Writer wants to find out the frequencies of the errors that the students had made. She asked her friends to collect twenty theses (chapter 5, conclusion part) to gain her data. The Data were all sentences contained grammatical and conventional writing errors. The Writer used qualitative approach and she analyzed the data by comparing all the errors that the students had made. The result of this research indicates that most students made errors in the writing of the absorption elements in their theses.
